summary: The West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2025 aims to permanently prohibit oil and gas exploration, development, and production on the outer Continental Shelf off the coasts of California, Oregon, and Washington. The bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prevent the Secretary from issuing leases or other authorizations for these activities in specific planning areas, as outlined in the 2024-2029 National Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program.
